intro: Oxylobium callistachys var. ovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed oxylobium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant features palmately lobed leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink and white. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native habitat.
